text: Psalm 20
God’s Blessing on the King
For the \add music\add* director. A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 20 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
May Yahweh answer you in \add the\add* day of trouble.
May the name of Jacob’s God protect\f + \fr 20:1 \ft The sense is that of making something inaccessibly high, like a fortress \f* you.
May he send you help\f + \fr 20:2 \ft Hebrew “your help” \f* from \add the\add* sanctuary,
and from Zion may he sustain you.
May he remember all your offerings,
and your burnt offering may he ⸤regard favorably⸥.\f + \fr 20:3 \ft Literally “find \fq to be \ft fat” \f*
May he give to you ⸤your heart’s desire⸥,\f + \fr 20:4 \ft Literally “according to your heart” \f*
and your every plan may he fulfill. \qs Selah\qs*
May we shout for joy over your victory,
and in the name of our God may we set up banners.
May Yahweh fulfill all your requests.
Now I know that Yahweh will help his anointed.\f + \fr 20:6 \ft Hebrew “messiah” \f*
He will answer him from his holy heaven
with the victorious power of his right hand.
⸤Some boast in chariots and others in horses⸥,\f + \fr 20:7 \ft Literally “These in the chariots and those in the horses” \f*
but we boast in the name of Yahweh, our God.
They will collapse and fall,
and we will rise and stand firm.
Rescue,\f + \fr 20:9 \ft Or “Grant victory” \f* O Yahweh.
Let the king answer us when we call.
